description:
EU officials say the Artificial Intelligence Act will protect the “fundamental rights” of citizens while also encouraging investment and innovation in the booming AI industry.

The post The European Union’s World-First Artificial Intelligence Rules Are Officially Taking Effect appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: The European Union’s World-First Artificial Intelligence Rules Are Officially Taking Effect

description:
Noteworthy stories that might have slipped under the radar: over 100 European banks undergo cyber resilience test, DDoS attacks don’t impact voting, and Tenable exploring a potential sale.

The post In Other News: European Banks Put to Test, Voting DDoS Attacks, Tenable Exploring Sale appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: In Other News: European Banks Put to Test, Voting DDoS Attacks, Tenable Exploring Sale

description:
AI and ML security provider Protect AI has raised $60 million in a Series B funding round led by Evolution Equity Partners.

The post Protect AI Raises $60 Million in Series B Funding appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Protect AI Raises $60 Million in Series B Funding

description:
A high-severity security bypass vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-6242 has been found and fixed in Rockwell Automation Logix controllers.

The post Security Bypass Vulnerability Found in Rockwell Automation Logix Controllers  appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Security Bypass Vulnerability Found in Rockwell Automation Logix Controllers

description:
The BlankBot Android trojan exfiltrates user data, executes C&C commands, and supports custom injections, keylogging, and screen recording.

The post New BlankBot Android Trojan Can Steal User Data appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: New BlankBot Android Trojan Can Steal User Data

description:
Threat actors are abusing Cloudflare’s TryCloudflare feature to create one-time tunnels for the distribution of remote access trojans.

The post Cloudflare Tunnels Abused for Malware Delivery appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Cloudflare Tunnels Abused for Malware Delivery

description:
An Avtech camera vulnerability that likely remains unfixed has been exploited in the wild, according to CISA.

The post CISA Warns of Avtech Camera Vulnerability Exploited in Wild appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: CISA Warns of Avtech Camera Vulnerability Exploited in Wild

description:
Threat actors have hijacked over 35,000 domains in five years because DNS providers fail to properly verify domain ownership.

The post Over 35k Domains Hijacked in ‘Sitting Ducks’ Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Over 35k Domains Hijacked in ‘Sitting Ducks’ Attacks

description:
Roundup of the more than two dozen cybersecurity-related merger and acquisition (M&A) deals announced in July 2024.

The post Cybersecurity M&A Roundup: 25 Deals Announced in July 2024 appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Cybersecurity M&A Roundup: 25 Deals Announced in July 2024
